intro: Coniogramme simplicior, commonly known as the simple coniogramme, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
